content: शंकर {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (रा --री|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [शं सुखं करोति कृ-अच्] Conferring happiness or prosperity, auspicious, propitious. --रः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a celebrated teacher and author; see App. II. --री {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Pārvatī, wife of Śiva. {@--2@} Bengal madder. {@--3@} The Śamī tree.

शंकर The celebrated teacher of the Vedānta philosophy and author of the शारीरकभाष्य and of a large number of original works, especially on Vedānta. He is said to have been born in 788 <ab>A. D.</ab> and to have died in 820 at the early age of 32. But some scholars (Mr. Telang, Dr. Bhandarkar &c.) have tried to show that Śaṅkara's date must be the 6th or 7th century at the latest. See Introduction to Mudrārākṣasa.
